00045 #ifndef __EXCEPTIONS_H__
00046 #define __EXCEPTIONS_H__
00047 
00048 #include <_ansi.h>
00049 
00050 _BEGIN_STD_C
00051 
00052 /*
00053  Exception vector offsets
00054 */
00055 #define EVBA_UNRECOVERABLE    0x000
00056 #define EVBA_TLB_MULTIPLE     0x004
00057 #define EVBA_BUS_ERROR_DATA   0x008
00058 #define EVBA_BUS_ERROR_INSTR  0x00C
00059 #define EVBA_NMI              0x010
00060 #define EVBA_INSTR_ADDR       0x014
00061 #define EVBA_ITLB_MISS        0x050
00062 #define EVBA_ITLB_PROT        0x018
00063 #define EVBA_BREAKPOINT       0x01C
00064 #define EVBA_ILLEGAL_OPCODE   0x020
00065 #define EVBA_UNIMPLEMENTED    0x024
00066 #define EVBA_PRIVILEGE_VIOL   0x028
00067 #define EVBA_FLOATING_POINT   0x02C
00068 #define EVBA_COP_ABSENT       0x030
00069 #define EVBA_SCALL            0x100
00070 #define EVBA_DATA_ADDR_R      0x034
00071 #define EVBA_DATA_ADDR_W      0x038
00072 #define EVBA_DTLB_MISS_R      0x060
00073 #define EVBA_DTLB_MISS_W      0x070
00074 #define EVBA_DTLB_PROT_R      0x03C
00075 #define EVBA_DTLB_PROT_W      0x040
00076 #define EVBA_DTLB_MODIFIED    0x044
00077 
00078 
00079 /*
00080    Define the form of the function used when registering exceptions.
00081    The function should return the address which the exception should
00082    return to after the exception processing.
00083 */
00084 
00085 typedef unsigned int (*__exception_handler)(int /*evba_offset*/, int /*return address*/);
00086 
00087 /*
00088    Define the form of the function used when registering a scall handler.
00089 */
00090 
00091 typedef void (*__scall_handler)(int /*code*/, int /*p1*/, int /*p2*/
00092                                          , int /*p3*/, int /*p4*/);
00093 
00094 /*
00095    Function for registering an exception handler for the exception with
00096    offset given by evba_offset.
00097 */
00098 void _register_exception_handler(__exception_handler handler, int evba_offset);
00099 
00100 /*
00101    Function for registering a scall handler which can be a arbirary
00102    function which uses r8-r12 for parameters.
00103 */
00104 void _register_scall_handler(__scall_handler handler);
00105 
00106 /*
00107    Initialize exceptions. Must be called before registering exception handlers
00108    and needed to enable exceptions. 'evba' is the pointer to the exception
00109    vector. 'handler_table' is a pointer to an array where the pointers to
00110    the exception handlers are stored. This array must be at least 0x104 bytes
00111    and word aligned.
00112 */
00113 void init_exceptions(void *evba, void *handler_table);
00114 void draw_kernel_panic(int tmp);
00115 
00116 _END_STD_C
00117 
00118 #endif
